channel.title: BBC News - Africa
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Sudan's Darfur conflict's latest surge in violence displaces thousands
item.description: "I have cried so much, my eyes can barely see," one mother tells the BBC after seeing her brother die.

item.title: Nigeria secures release of 100 kidnapped mothers and children
item.description: The group, most of them women and children, were kidnapped last month in Nigeria's Zamfara state.

item.title: South Africa riots: Delayed response gave plotters a ‘field day’ - minister
item.description: The riots sparked by the jailing of former South African President Jacob Zuma were part of a planned insurrection, a minister says.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Egypt's Sherif to 'play with heart' in historic medal bid
item.description: Mayar Sherif will play 'with her heart' as she becomes the first Egyptian woman to play Olympic tennis for her country.

item.title: Nigeria's security crises - five different threats
item.description: Almost every part of Nigeria is facing a security crisis - from kidnapping to extremist insurgencies.

item.title: South Africa Zuma riots: What's behind the violence and looting?
item.description: Some analysts say the violence wasn't spontaneous anger but a deliberate strategy of sabotage.

item.title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: Fleeing for fear of new ethnic conflict
item.description: "War is inevitable - it is ethnic cleansing," says an Ethiopian doctor who has escaped to Sudan.

item.title: South Africa Zuma riots: Fact-checking claims about the protests
item.description: We've looked at some examples of misleading images and videos, claiming to be from the current protests.

item.title: Covid in Namibia: 'Fifteen of my relatives have died'
item.description: Namibia is suffering one of the world's worst outbreaks of Covid, as ex-footballer Marley Ngarizemo can testify.

item.title: South Africa looting: I'm struggling to find food
item.description: A Durban resident tells the BBC he is struggling for food and medicine after so many shops were looted.

item.title: 'My husband was an angel - then he raped me'
item.description: Marital rape has long been a taboo issue in Egypt, but now victims are beginning to speak out.

item.title: Joshi is swapping life in captivity for a new start in the jungle
item.description: After a lifetime in captivity, Joshi is going to live in the jungle in Congo-Brazzaville.

item.title: Tokyo 2020 Olympics: Kenya's Taekwondo star and environmental activist
item.description: Kenya's Taekwondo star Faith Ogallo hopes to win a medal in Tokyo - to raise environmental awareness.

item.title: South Africa riots: The community standing up to looters
item.description: The government has said it will deploy 25,000 troops, but some residents are already taking action.

item.title: How Moroccan Asmaa Niang's Olympic career was sparked by dreams of being a superhero
item.description: Morocco’s Asmaa Niang will be competing in judo. This will be her second Games – but her Olympic career was sparked by her childhood dreams of being a superhero.

item.title: South Africa Zuma riots: Mother on throwing baby from burning building
item.description: The building was allegedly set on fire by looters amid an eruption of riots across South Africa.

item.title: South Africa riots: What's happening and why?
item.description: The military are helping police quell unrest following the jailing of former President Jacob Zuma.

item.title: South Africa Zuma riots: Child thrown from burning building
item.description: The mother and baby in Durban, eastern South Africa, were safely reunited after their rescue.
